statement: The system shall allow each team to manage its own budget (income and expenses).
The system shall allow the IFA to monitor and audit team budgets.
The system shall allow the IFA to specify budget policies and alert on violations.
The system shall allow IFA administrators to view all team financial transactions.
The system shall restrict budget transaction insertion to teams only, and each team shall only access its own budget data.
The system shall allow the IFA to view all monetary information but not perform operations on the data.
The system shall allow referees to insert game events in real time using a mobile phone.
The system shall restrict game event updates to referees only (main or side referee).
The system shall record game events including goals, offsides, red cards, player replacements, each with a timestamp and event-specific details.
The system shall allow all users, including unregistered guests, to view game data and results.
The system shall support exporting game data (e.g. for journalists and press).
The system shall allow team managers and team administration to view and export their own team data for offline analysis.
The system shall support automatic scheduling of games per league per season.
The system shall allow the IFA to define scheduling policies and constraints (e.g. home/away rotation, minimum gap between matches, day of week).
The system shall provide guidance for allocating referees to games based on defined policies.
The system shall enforce referee scheduling policies (e.g. same referee not assigned to same team too often, equal distribution of games among referees).
The system shall allow referees to input their availability and preferences (e.g. vacation dates).
The system shall allow manual adjustment of the schedule for cancellations (weather, emergencies).
The system shall allow IFA representatives to override the automatic schedule, requiring a written rationale and confirmation by a second IFA representative.
The system shall push notifications to fans who subscribe to specific games, players, or events.
The system shall allow fans to register and subscribe to specific games, teams, and players to receive notifications.
The system shall notify subscribed fans in real time when game events occur (e.g. player replacement reported by referee).
The system shall allow fans to set custom alerts (e.g. reminder 5 minutes before a game).
The system shall allow players to manage their own social network page and post messages to fans.
The system shall support at least 50,000 simultaneous users.
The system shall provide a response time of 1-2 seconds for fans and administrators.
The system shall provide real-time, high-priority responsiveness for the referee interface during games.
The system shall provide a web-based interface for IFA administrators and team administration, and a mobile application for referees and fans.
The system shall be a unified system with different presentation layers and role-based access control for different stakeholders.
The system shall support localization including language, currency, and timezone adjustments.
The system shall comply with local data residency regulations (e.g. German data must stay in Germany).
The system shall encrypt budget data to prevent leakage.
The system shall be hosted on cloud infrastructure with outsourced development and maintenance.
The system shall ensure game event data is coherent and reliable, with referees as the sole authoritative source.
The system shall retain all historical data and past season archives.
The system shall require user registration and authentication for system access; unregistered users have guest-level access only.
The system shall support a team registration process where the team owner/manager submits documents to the IFA for approval.
The system shall allow the IFA to register and invite referees to the system.
The system shall allow teams to manage their own players, coaches, stadium, and other resources.
The system shall allow the IFA to define leagues, seasons, and activate scheduling policies.
The system shall support automatic reminder notifications (e.g. annual budget report submission reminders).
